metadata.title: CVE-2023-21255 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In multiple functions of binder.c, there is a possible memory corruptiondue to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilegewith no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is notneeded for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-21255` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-162.179~18.04.1').
